html:
waste/desolate places/narrow. Israel's promised land has been laid waste and made empty, but when the gathering occurs, the available land will be too small for the great influx of those who are gathered (54:1-3). The waste places of Zion are symbolic of Israel's loss—both spiritual and physical—that shall be restored (58:12; D&C 101:75; 103:11). The restoration of the waste places thus brings joy and comfort (51:3; 52:9).

they that swallowed thee…far away. Israel's enemies, or our spiritual enemies, will be far from us.
